description: Originally, it was probably used as an abbreviation of butcher. Later, in the 1940s, the sense “masculine lesbian” developed.

adjectives.description: butch (comparative butcher or more butch, superlative butchest or most butch)

entries.meaning: (slang, originally Polari) Very masculine, with a masculine appearance or attitude.
examples: Synonyms: macho, manly, mannish, unfeminine, masc

entries.meaning: (slang, LGBT, countable) A lesbian who appears masculine or acts in a masculine manner.
examples: Synonyms: bull dyke, dyke; see also Thesaurus:female homosexual
